title: Fort Sumter National Monument: Videos
body: Videos                         National Park Week at the National Parks in Charleston, SC Picture yourself at one of the four National Park Service sites in Charleston, South Carolina this National Park Week, April 21-29, 2012.  Duration:31 seconds                                Fort Sumter Overview Fort Sumter overview with staff commentary.  Duration:4 minutes, 3 seconds                                Sesquicentennial Commemoration at Fort Sumter For nine days in April 2011, the National Park Service along with its partners and the public commemorated the first shots of the American Civil War. This 21 minute video allows viewers to get a brief look at what those nine days entailed and the importance of commemorating events such as these. Although the commemoration is over, the National Park Service at Fort Sumter continues to help visitors interpret and understand the events of that day and what those events mean to us 150 years later. As National Park Service Director Jon Jarvis said in July 2011, "I can promise you that we will be here everyday of every year watching over this place, to keep it and protect it; to pass it's story on to future generations of Americans."  Duration:21 minutes, 42 seconds                                Sesquicentennial Commemoration Ceremony - Introduction Superintendent Tim Stone gives the introduction at the Fort Sumter Sesquicentennial Commemoration Ceremony on April 12, 2011.  Duration:3 minutes, 1 second                                Regional Director David Vela speaks at Fort Sumter National Monument Southeast Regional Director David Vela speaks at the Sesquicentennial Commemoration at Fort Sumter National Monument in April 2011.  Duration:3 minutes, 14 seconds
